Bank may have taken down one of the original Ocean's Eleven, but his efforts only managed to unite the remaining ten closer than ever before. As the opening of Bank's newest casino draws near, Danny and the crew set into motion a bold plan to humiliate the cocksure casino owner and forever tarnish his spotless reputation. It won't be easy, but if Ocean and his team can get their elaborate plan together in time for the opening of The Bank, they just might be able to deliver some serious Las Vegas justice(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A raunchy yet heartfelt comedy from director Judd Apatow about Amy (Amy Schumer), a commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City, who must reevaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her(n)

programme.title: Baby Boom
programme.desc: Amiable comedy in which a supercharged New York business executive finds her life turned upside down when she becomes the reluctant guardian of a relative's baby. Her hectic schedule has no time for nappies and baby food, and she soon loses both her job and her boyfriend. But after relocating to a farmhouse and discovering the easy pace of country life, she finds that she is more suited to motherhood than she thinks

programme.desc: Push Pull Rock. Topics include "Push," "Pull" and "Rock."

programme.desc: Pinky and the Castle of Cards; Daddy's Special Shirt. Pinky tells a story about a king who built a castle out of playing cards but then had difficulty enjoying his creation. programme.desc: A small-town teen's singing video goes viral and catapults her and her sister's band into global super stardom, but their newfound fame threatens to break apart their familial bonds in this spirited adapted musical fantasy

programme.title: Shrek the Third
programme.desc: When his froggy father-in-law croaks it, Shrek sets off to find a replacement ruler. If he can't find a suitable sovereign, he'll have to take the throne himself... but Prince Charming has his eye on the crown too

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Adventure tale about a rather clueless DIY detective with his own built-in tool kit whose grafted-on gizmos and gadgets make him a one-man army and more than a match for the evil Dr Claw

programme.title: Problem Child 3
programme.desc: Junior Healy experiencing the pangs of young love for the first time when he falls for an attractive classmate

programme.title: Hoot
programme.desc: Wil Shriner's family film, based on Carl Hiaasen's novel, stars Logan Lerman as Roy Eberhardt, who, thanks to his father's job, is at his eighth school in six years, this time in Florida. There, he makes friends with Beatrice and Mullet Fingers. Mullet is involved in low-level sabotage to stop a chain restaurant building on a nesting site used by rare burrowing owls and the other two join his in his eco-battle against inept contractor Curly and his greedy boss Muckle

programme.title: Jem and the Holograms
programme.desc: A small-town teen's singing video goes viral and catapults her and her sister's band into global super stardom, but their newfound fame threatens to break apart their familial bonds in this spirited adapted musical fantasy

programme.title: Charlotte's Web
programme.desc: This animated musical, based on E.B. White's children's book classic, is about a courageous spider who helps save the life of an ill-fated pig. Wilbur is a young pig (voice of Henry Gibson) who's owned by New England farmer Homer Zuckerman (voice of Robert Holt). One day he is sold to a neighbor, where he meets a sheep who warns him that his fate lies in the confines of the slaughterhouse. Wilbur is terrified of this news until he meets Charlotte, a charming spider (voice of Debbie Reynolds), who is determined to save Wilbur from this dire destiny. By weaving words into her web, she convinces the farmer that Wilbur is some sort of prodigious animal too important to kill. The music for Charlotte's Web was written by Richard M. Sherman and Robert B. Sherman, who wrote the scores for countless Disney movies, including Mary Poppins and The Jungle Book

programme.title: Dolphin Tale 2
programme.desc: A group of sympathetic humans help a dolphin with a damaged tail in this sequel to the 2011 film inspired by actual events

programme.desc: Two tiger cubs are captured and their parents shot dead. One ends up a whimpering circus performer, the other a ferocious caged beast. Then they are pitted against each other for sport(n)

programme.desc: A look at "Jurassic World" (2015), the fourth installment in the "Jurassic Park" series that unfolds 22 years after the 1993 original and features a new dinosaur theme park on Isla Nubar. The film stars Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard and Vincent D'Onofrio, and is directed by Colin Trevorrow(n)

programme.desc: Directed by Robert Schwentke, the second film in the Divergent series find Tris (Shailene Woodley) and Four (Theo James) on the run from Jeanine Matthews (Kate Winslet) while trying to figure out the secret that will help the rebels build a new and better future(n)

Now, unless the reluctant would-be king can find a suitable replacement, he'll be royally screwed for the rest of his days(n)

programme.title: The Electric Company
programme.desc: Friends or Aunts. Keith and Hector compete against Annie Scrambler and her Aunt Sandy on a cheesy game show(n)

programme.title: Evan Almighty
programme.desc: Divine comedy sequel to 2003's "Bruce Almighty." A hilarious Steve Carell reprises his role as newscaster (now Congressman) Evan Baxter, who's summoned by God to build an ark. Morgan Freeman once again takes on the role of the deity. Directed by Tom Shadyac, who also helmed the original. Lauren Graham costars as Evan's disbelieving wife. Wanda Sykes, John Goodman, Molly Shannon, John Michael Higgins(n)

programme.title: The Cup
programme.desc: Phar Lap director Simon Wincer returns to the world of horse racing with this inspirational true story about one man's quest to pay tribute to his fallen brother by winning the Melbourne Cup. The sons of legendary jockey Ray Oliver -- who was killed during a horse race in Western Australia -- Damien (Stephen Curry) and Jason Oliver (Daniel MacPherson) followed in their father's footsteps by becoming champion riders. But in the run-up to the prestigious Melbourne Cup, a tragedy on the track kills Jason, and leaves his brother deeply shaken. Initially doubting he will ever find the courage to ride again, Damien summons the courage to compete in the Melbourne Cup and honor his brother's memory with the help of Dermot Weld (Brendan Gleeson), a celebrated horse trainer from Ireland who's convinced Damien has the makings of a true champion. Later, as Damien and his horse Media Puzzle approach the starting line, race fans from around the world cheer them on(n)

programme.title: Camp Nowhere
programme.desc: This light-hearted comedy depicts a typical summer camp, but with a special twist: this camp was designed by the campers themselves! "Mud" Himmel is a nerd. Once again he is faced with attending computer camp. His buddy Zack will be marching into go to military camp while Trish is acting happy about theater camp. That Gaby is going again to fat camp weighs heavily upon her mind. None of them are thrilled with their camp prospects and it is rebellious Mud who suggest that they create their own, secret camp. Enter Dennis Van Welker, their crazy high school drama instructor. He offers to join the conspiracy and act as their camp counselor. Just as it looks as if the four misfits are going to have a really great summer together, two dozen of their peers find out about the camp and decide to come along. For a time it's one big chaotic party. But as the kids act out their camp fantasies, they are gaining valuable insight into their lives(n)

programme.title: Like Mike 2: Streetball
programme.desc: Forget about the arena, because in this sequel to the 2002 slam-dunk basketball hit Like Mike, it's all about the quest to become the King of Concrete. Jerome Jenkins Jr. is a pint-sized street-ball player with larger-than-life dreams of dominating the open-air court. Vertically challenged, uncoordinated, and decidedly lacking in speed, Jerome fails to earn the respect of his peers on the court until he discovers a mysterious pair of sneakers that instill him with the power to make his dreams of winning become reality. Now, as Jerome's newfound talents send him rocketing to street stardom and his swelling ego eclipses his youthful sense of wonder, it's up to the street-ball superstar's family and friends to show him what it really means to be a winner on the court as well as off(n)

programme.title: Jonas Brothers: The Concert Experience
programme.desc: A 3-D concert film of the 2008 Jonas Brothers Burning Up concert tour, as well as documentary footage on the lives of the three brothers(n)

programme.title: Evan Almighty
programme.desc: Divine comedy sequel to 2003's "Bruce Almighty." A hilarious Steve Carell reprises his role as newscaster (now Congressman) Evan Baxter, who's summoned by God to build an ark. Morgan Freeman once again takes on the role of the deity. Directed by Tom Shadyac, who also helmed the original. Lauren Graham costars as Evan's disbelieving wife. Wanda Sykes, John Goodman, Molly Shannon, John Michael Higgins(n)

programme.title: Dr. Dolittle 2
programme.desc: In this so-so sequel, the good doctor (Eddie Murphy) tries to mate two endangered bears to save a forest marked for destruction. The animals are funny; the plot standard; the humor broad. Voice talent features Norm Macdonald, Steve Zahn and Lisa Kudrow(n)

programme.title: Like Mike
programme.desc: Pint-size rap music star Lil Bow Wow shows that he can play ball as well as he raps in this youth-oriented comedy about a young boy whose dream comes true in an unexpected way. Calvin Cambridge (Lil Bow Wow) is a 14-year-old boy, who, since the death of his parents, has been living in an orphanage run by the unpleasantly eccentric Stan Bittleman (Crispin Glover). While the tough but caring Sister Theresa (Anne Meara) tries to encourage the kids, Calvin knows that he and most of the other kids his age are poor prospects for adoption. Calvin loves basketball and idolizes Michael Jordan, but he's too short to be much of a challenge to the older kids when shooting hoop at the playground. One day, Calvin discovers a pair of old basketball sneakers with the initials "MJ" written on the inside. Calvin is convinced they once belonged to Michael Jordan, but he can hardly believe what happens when he puts them on -- suddenly he's able to make superhuman jump shots and dunks just like a miniature version of Air Jordan himself. Calvin's newly developed talent on the court comes to the attention of Frank Bernard (Eugene Levy), the manager of the Los Angeles Knights, an NBA team having a humiliating season. Bernard brings Calvin to the team as a novelty item, but with the help of Coach Wagner (Robert Forster) and the new kid's can-do attitude, the Knights start to climb out of the cellar and look like possible season champs. However, Tracey Reynolds (Morris Chestnut), who used to be the team's star player, isn't happy to have his thunder stolen by a 14-year-old boy -- especially when he's made Calvin's roommate and de-facto guardian on the road. Like Mike also features cameo appearances by a number of pro basketball stars, including Allen Iverson, Chris Webber, and Jason Kidd(n)

programme.title: Eight Legged Freaks
programme.desc: A variety of horrible poisonous spiders get exposed to a noxious chemical that causes them to grow to monumental proportions(n)

programme.title: Drop Zone
programme.desc: Skydiving ace Ty Moncrief lands on federal buildings and steals files containing the names of undercover agents which he sells to drug barons. Pete Nessip is the marshal who takes to the air to bring him down. Action

programme.title: Cry-Baby
programme.desc: A parody of 1950s teen musicals involving a bad boy who falls for a rich girl

programme.title: Shutter
programme.desc: An American couple honeymooning in Japan think they knocked a woman over but can find no trace of her. Then she starts appearing in their photos... Then ghostly apparitions start appearing on their holiday photographs, followed by Jane beginning to have visions of the woman she believes she killed. At first sceptical, Ben is convinced after a terrifying encounter in his darkroom but how can the couple assuage the vengeful being?

programme.title: The Jacket
programme.desc: After a roadside incident in 1992, traumatised soldier Jack blacks out and wakes up straitjacketed in a facility for the criminally insane. Somehow he is transported to 2007 where he meets a young woman who can help him alter his terrible past

programme.title: Trouble With the Curve
programme.desc: Celebrated baseball scout Gus Lobel re-teams with his estranged daughter when the front office of the Atlanta Braves begins to question his recent decisions and whether he has become too old to continue with his career. Together they hit the road to scout a promising young player and along the way they learn just how much they have in common

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: Tight-knit gang of street racers battle a new nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists

programme.title: Making of 'Furious 7'
programme.desc: A look at "Furious 7," a 2015 thriller about a man seeking revenge on the Toretto gang for the death of his brother. The film stars Vin Diesel, Paul Walker and Jason Statham, and is directed by James Wan

programme.title: Blackhat
programme.desc: A furloughed convict teams with a joint American-Chinese anticyber-theft task force to root out a hacker based in Southeast Asia

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber To
programme.desc: Lloyd and Harry set out on a road trip to find the latter's long-lost daughter

programme.title: Not Another Teen Movie
programme.desc: Jake Wyler is an all-American jock who bets that he can turn the cute-ugly duckling Janey Briggs into a prom queen

programme.title: Van Helsing
programme.desc: Outcast Van Helsing is charged with a mission to go to the shadowy world of Transylvania and vanquish the evil Count Dracula. He joins forces with a beautiful woman descended from a powerful royal family, but finds that his goal of annihilating the enemy brings him face to face with his own past

programme.title: Blackhat
programme.desc: A furloughed convict teams with a joint American-Chinese anticyber-theft task force to root out a hacker based in Southeast Asia

programme.title: Juno
programme.desc: Jason Reitman's comedy drama stars Oscar-nominee Ellen Page as Juno McGuff, 16 and pregnant after an encounter with sometime boyfriend Paulie Bleeker. She tells her father Mac and stepmother Bren she intends to have the baby and then hand it over for adoption

programme.title: Not Another Teen Movie
programme.desc: Jake Wyler is an all-American jock who bets that he can turn the cute-ugly duckling Janey Briggs into a prom queen(n)

programme.title: Inherent Vice
programme.desc: In this offbeat detective story set in 1970 California, a drug-addled private eye investigates a conspiracy involving his ex-flame and her married, real-estate-developer boyfriend. Meanwhile, various eccentric characters complicate the investigation(n)

programme.title: American Splendor
programme.desc: (2003) Harvey Pekar (Paul Giamatti) is a hospital filing clerk with a penchant for rare jazz records and otherwise, well, a pretty dead-end life. But he becomes famous through his friendship with cartoonist Robert Crumb (James Urbaniak), who takes Harvey's stickman-illustrated musings on his everyday life and turns them into one of America's most successful cult comic books. Shari Springer Berman and Robert Pulcini's film mixes drama, animation and interjections from the real-life Pekar in this genuinely unique Oscar-nominated, Sundance-winning comedy-drama. M,W,R,S(n)

programme.title: Snakes on a Plane
programme.desc: An FBI agent has his hands full when a jet cargo of creepy-crawly critters is unleashed on passengers by a mob boss trying to do away with a murder witness(n)

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives get more complicated than they anticipated(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
programme.desc: The Fantastic Four learn that they aren't the only super-powered beings in the universe when they square off against the powerful Silver Surfer and the planet-eating Galactus(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: The Barden Bellas are back, determined to enter (and win) an international competition. After a disasterous performance elsewhere, the Bellas have much more to prove if they want to become the best(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: In this hip reboot of the comic-book franchise, a brilliant scientist builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past(n)

programme.title: The Wrestler
programme.desc: Mickey Rourke is a fading pro-wrestler struggling to adjust to life outside the ring in this Oscar-winning 2008 movie(n)

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: Four working class stiffs pool their money for a high stakes card game, but things go wrong and they end up owing half a million pounds to the wrong people!(n)

programme.title: A Walk Among the Tombstones
programme.desc: A heroin trafficker whose wife was abducted and murdered hires a haunted private investigator to track down the men who killed her in this brooding crime drama starring Liam Neeson. Matt Scudder (Neeson) was an NYPD cop having a quiet drink in a Washington Heights bar when a pair of armed robbers came in guns blazing. Giving chase, Scudder kills the robbers in the street, though a stray bullet turns a heroic moment tragic. Devastated, Scudder subsequently goes to work as an unlicensed private detective, working just outside of the law and surviving on generous gifts offered in exchange for his services. Now, tasked with rooting out the sadistic thugs who brutally murdered the wife of a wealthy drug dealer (Dan Stevens), Scudder scours the bars and back alleys of New York City in search of his elusive targets -- and the closer he gets, the more apparent it becomes that they are something much more sinister than your typical kidnappers(n)

programme.title: Kiss the Girls
programme.desc: Washington DC detective Dr. Alex Cross travels to North Carolina to investigate the apparent kidnapping of his niece. Aided by escaped kidnapee Kate McTiernan, Cross hunts down the kidnapper, who operates under the pseudonym "Cassanova". Starring Morgan Freeman, Gina Ravera and Ashley Judd

programme.title: Blood and Wine
programme.desc: A wealthy wine dealer plans a jewel heist when his money starts to run out. Bob Rafelson directed

programme.title: The Uninvited
programme.desc: After the death of her ill mother in a fire, the young teenager Anna tries to commit suicide and is sent to a mental institution for treatment. Ten months later, Anna still cannot remember what had happened on the night her mother died

programme.title: The Last of the Blonde Bombshells
programme.desc: After her husband dies, an English widow picks up her tenor sax and hunts down her former swing bandmates, and urges them to play again

programme.title: My Life in Ruins
programme.desc: Tour guide Georgia is single, miserable and sick of leading uninterested holidaymakers around ancient Greek ruins. She's set to head home to the US, but could love finally be on the horizon?

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A a meek univeristy student living on her own in New York City meets Brooke, her stepsister-to-be, and is soon entranced by her worldliness and flummoxed by her impulsive nature

programme.title: 27 Dresses
programme.desc: Wedding mania gets a comic spin in the tale of Jane (Katherine Heigl), who's always a bridesmaid and never a bride. Jane's passion for all things nuptial is tested when she's asked to plan her sister's wedding to the man she secretly loves. A cynical columnist (James Marsden) who falls for Jane while surreptitiously writing a human-interest story about her further complicates Jane's dreams of love and marriage

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride, a helicopter pilot races to rescue his daughter and estranged wife as a series of massive earthquakes devastate California. Meanwhile, a Cal Tech professor attempts to warn other citizens

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending
programme.desc: In this mind-blowing sci-fi epic in which human beings are the least-evolved species in the known universe, an ex-soldier protects a seemingly ordinary woman who's been targeted for assassination by a ruthless queen

programme.title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Sonny prepares to expand the Best Exotic Marigold Hotel for the Elderly and Beautiful while planning his impending wedding to Sunaina

programme.title: Barbershop 2: Back in Business
programme.desc: Kevin Rodney Sullivan steps in to direct the urban comedy sequel Barbershop 2: Back in Business. The whole gang -- Eddie (Cedric the Entertainer), Jimmy James (Sean Patrick Thomas), Terri (Eve), Isaac (Troy Garity), Ricky (Michael Ealy), and Dinka (Leonard Earl Howze) -- are still there in the same old barbershop in the south side of Chicago. Owner Calvin Palmer (Ice Cube) tries to keep his family business alive in order to pass it on to his own son one day. However, the beloved neighborhood barber shop is threatened by a hair salon franchise called Nappy Cuts. This time around, the old friends are joined by Gina (Queen Latifah) from the beauty shop next door

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride, a helicopter pilot races to rescue his daughter and estranged wife as a series of massive earthquakes devastate California. Meanwhile, a Cal Tech professor attempts to warn other citizens

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This riveting crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss

programme.title: Lost River
programme.desc: A spellbinding fantasy about a financially strapped single mother who descends into a dark world in order to protect her family, while her son confronts the town bully and discovers a hidden utopia(n)

programme.title: Standing Still
programme.desc: When a diverse group of lifelong friends comes together to celebrate the marriage of devoted couple Elise (Amy Adams) and Michael (Adam Garcia), the mixed-up relationships of the past pave the road to a weekend no one is likely to soon forget in the feature debut from filmmaker Matthew Cole Weiss. The setting is Los Angeles, CA, and the event is the wedding between a man and a woman who always seemed destined to be together. Unfortunately, all relationships can't be as healthy as Elise and Michael's is, and though best man and maid of honor Rich (Aaron Stanford) and Samantha (Melissa Sagemiller) seem to be preparing to take the plunge, the same certainly cannot be said for neurotic actress Lana (Mena Suvari). A free-spirited soul who has experienced flings with a variety of wedding attendees including the hapless Pockets (Jon Abrahams), alcoholic actor Simon (James Van Der Beek), and manic children's television program host Donovan (Ethan Embry), Lana attempts to sort out her past flings as lovelorn agent Quentin (Colin Hanks) pines for the bride's sister and the estranged father of the groom attempts to reconnect with his long-lost son(n)

programme.title: Georgia Rule
programme.desc: Powerhouse performances by Jane Fonda, Felicity Huffman and Lindsay Lohan spark this touching and bittersweet saga of three generations of family members dealing with past and present problems, including rape, addictions and promiscuity. Directed by Garry Marshall(n)

programme.title: Jem and the Holograms
programme.desc: A small-town teen's singing video goes viral and catapults her and her sister's band into global superstardom, but their newfound fame threatens to break apart their familial bonds(n)

programme.title: Far From the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: An adaptation of Thomas Hardy's seminal novel about a beautiful but headstrong woman who attracts three very different male suitors throughout her life in Victorian England(n)

programme.title: A Perfect Murder
programme.desc: Millionaire industrialist Steven Taylor is a man who has everything but what he craves most, the love and the fidelity of his wife. A hugely successful player in the financial world, he considers her to be his most treasured acquisition. But she needs more than the role of a dazzling accessory. Brilliant in her own right, she is involved with a struggling artist who fulfills her emotional needs. Her husband discovers her indiscretion and sets out to commit the perfect murder(n)

programme.title: The Night Of
programme.desc: The Beach. An eight-part drama series following a murder case in New York City. In the opener, a perfect night for a Pakistani-American student turns into a nightmare when he is arrested for murder(n)

programme.title: Paper Towns
programme.desc: Adapted from the young adult novel by John Green, Fox 2000's Paper Towns tells the story of the bizarre mystery that unfolds in the wake of an acute youthful trauma. After stumbling across the body of a suicide victim, two young neighbors gradually begin to drift apart. Years later, the girl appears at the boy's window in a ninja costume, and requests his help in punishing those who were cruel to her. The following day she disappears without a trace, leaving him in a state of emotional flux as he follows a bizarre trail of clues in hopes of tracking her down(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Donald Trump's legal battles; Trump University; and the debt-buying industry are discussed(n)

programme.title: Juno
programme.desc: (2007) Jason Reitman's comedy drama stars Oscar-nominee Ellen Page as Juno McGuff, 16 and pregnant after an encounter with sometime boyfriend Paulie Bleeker (Michael Cera). She tells her father Mac and stepmother Bren (JK Simmons and Allison Janney) she intends to have the baby and then hand it over for adoption. In the pages of the PennySaver, she finds childless couple Vanessa and Mark Loring (Jennifer Garner and Jason Bateman) who look like the ideal couple. But, as the months progress and her stomach swells, Juno begins to doubt both them and her course of action. Oscar-winning Diablo Cody's whip-smart script keeps the laughs coming and the action moving in one of the most lauded movies of recent years(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Drama about an unconventional new English teacher and his ultimately questionable impact on an elite Vermont boys' academy. Robin Williams, in a straight role, blows into the stuffy halls of academe like a breath of fresh air, startling colleagues and delighting boys with his disdain for traditional teaching methods and text books. But the seeds of rebellion he sows have far-reaching effects that he never intended(n)

programme.title: The Night Of
programme.desc: The Beach. An eight-part drama series following a murder case in New York City. In the opener, a perfect night for a Pakistani-American student turns into a nightmare when he is arrested for murder(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, an intelligent but self-conscious deskbound CIA analyst (Melissa McCarthy) is finally given the chance to go undercover as a homely "cat lady" in order to save her missing partner (Jude Law) and thwart a global disaster at the hands of a dangerous arms dealer. Written and directed by Paul Feig(n)

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: M Night Shyamalan's widely acclaimed chiller about a boy who has the not-entirely-welcome ability to directly contact the dead. Bruce Willis stars as child psychologist Dr Malcolm Crowe, who is asked to help Cole Sear (Haley Joel Osment), who claims he can 'see dead people'. Crowe is sceptical at first, but - prompted partly by a similar case from his past, who he felt he badly let down - he's gradually convinced that the boy is telling the truth. Crowe believes that actively engaging with the ghostly presences could help both Sear and the spirits to find peace. Overcoming his terror, the lad finds that communicating with the deceased does, at first, seem to be beneficial. But then matters take on their own momentum, leading to one of the director's trademark plot twists..(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days co-stars Kate Hudson and Matthew McConaughey re-team on the big screen for this adventurous tale about a treasure-hunting couple whose eight-year quest for the ultimate prize has left them flat broke and fresh out of gas. Ben "Finn" Finnegan (McConaughey) is a treasure hunter who has made it his mission in life to track down the Queen's Dowry -- a legendary collection of 40 chests filled with priceless treasure, and lost at sea in 1715. But in his single-minded quest to track down this sizable booty, Finn has sadly neglected his marriage to his loving wife Tess (Hudson). Tess has grown tired of the hunt, and now she's looking to start her life anew by going to work on the massive yacht of globetrotting billionaire Nigel Honeycutt (Donald Sutherland). But just as Tess begins to relish the freedom on her new, laid-back lifestyle, Finn uses his roughish charm to convince the adventurous baron and his debutante daughter Gemma (Alexis Dziena) that the elusive Spanish treasure is finally within reach. Of course no magnate in his right mind would reject the prospect of tracking down the most mythical treasure on the planet, and now as the hapless Tess is forced on yet another wild goose chase, her husband's former mentor Moe Fitch (Ray Winstone) and a greedy local gangster (Kevin Hart) up the stakes by joining in on the race(n)

programme.desc: The team captains are joined by the 2014 winner of The Voice Jermain Jackman, Wolfblood's Bobby Lockwood, comedienne Katherine Ryan and TV presenter Nihal Arthanayake.(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: Muffy tries to find her long-lost imaginary friend, but she has to be careful as the Crosswire basement is full of bewitched boxes and gadgets.(n)

programme.title: Zig and Zag
programme.desc: The duo join the Junior Woodpeckers to get badges, but end up causing havoc on their maiden camping trip.(n)

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: When an old enemy returns, Colonel K must come out of retirement to save the world from an outbreak of rudeness.(n)

programme.title: Dragons: Defenders of Berk
programme.desc: The children go on a training mission on Dragon Island, and Hiccup runs into an old enemy.(n)

programme.title: Whoops I Missed the Bus
programme.desc: A chance to revisit some of CBBC's highlights from the past week, including clips from Horrible Histories and Blue Peter. Plus, Tee Cee reviews Odd Squad.(n)

programme.title: HH: Gory Games
programme.desc: Will, Ellie and Sam travel down the time sewer to play quirky quizzes and disgusting games, including The Battle of Actium, Factory Fingers and London's Burning.(n)

programme.title: Nine Minute Ninja
programme.desc: Ricky takes to the skies as he makes some amazing Wing Shoes, shows us how fly through the air in a magical animation and feeds his Box Monster using a Da Vinci inspired catapult.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Blue Peter brings you more from the special CBBC Awesome Authors weekend. We put Jacqueline Wilson to the test in a quiz against a team of super fans! Some of your favourite authors such as David Baddiel and Alex Smith join in with fun and games and Lindsey reads some of your Blue Peter letters at Letters Live.(n)

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: 2016 is the BBC's 'Year of the Story' and as part of the celebration, the award winning Horrible Histories returns with a one-off special about Staggering Storytellers. Who wrote the first detective novel? When were books invented? Why do we like stories so much? In its own distinctive and irreverently accurate style, the episode takes a look at some of literature's greatest works and history's wackiest writers. Along the way we see the development of storytelling technology; we learn how a party at Lord Byron's house led to the writing of the Gothic masterpiece Frankenstein, and how Charles Dickens was the Harry Styles of his day. Spanning 3,000 years of recorded history we take a look at the funny and ridiculous ways some of our finest writers cured their writing block - did you know Tennyson used to pretend to go the loo as a party trick? Plus, of course, our trusty host Rattus to guide the way.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch
programme.desc: Matilda Ramsay cooks a Cornish feast - seaside spaghetti made with local sausages, Cornish pilchards on toast and some biscuits called Cornish Fairings.(n)

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: James and Riley struggle with their duet, while Michelle asks Eldon why he is avoiding her.(n)

programme.title: Lost & Found Music Studios
programme.desc: Drama following the lives of children who are members of an after-school music programme. Leia hopes to write and perform a song for Luke, who she has a crush on, but he is preoccupied with helping his best friend John express his feelings for dancer Michelle.(n)

programme.title: Taking the Next Step
programme.desc: Day 1 of National Auditions in Manchester and 53 dancers from Regionals face our judges again. Kimberly Wyatt, John Partridge and Simeon Qsyea must decide who will make it through today and get one step closer to that guest role on The Next Step.(n)

programme.desc: Competition is fierce for a spot on the football team, and Nathan and Alex battle it out.(n)

programme.desc: Characters from history perform songs of tales of their lives, including Alexander the Great, Joan of Arc, Charles Dickens and Rosa Parks.(n)

programme.title: Newsround

programme.title: How to Be Epic @ Everything
programme.desc: Experts demonstrate how to rap, act, sound like, dress like, and direct Shakespeare. With famous faces such as actress Maxine Peake, actor Ben Crystal, and Hip Hop Shakespeare Company's Lorianne Tika-Lemba.(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground Dish Up
programme.desc: An extra treat from the BBC Dish Up healthy eating season. Catch up with your favourite past residents of The Dumping Ground as they reunite to cook fun and tasty recipes.(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Tee gets a taste of what life outside care might be like when she goes for her first college interview. However, sparks fly between her and Carmen when neither of their days go according to plan. Drama based on books by Jacqueline Wilson, starring Mia McKenna-Bruce and Amy Leigh Hickman.(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Unsure of where she fits in, Sasha is glad when an old friend seems to show an interest in her. But does he really have her best interests at heart? Drama based on books by Jacqueline Wilson, starring Annabelle Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Election fever strikes the Dumping Ground as Tyler and Floss battle it out over a place on a forum for children in care. However, Ryan sees the chaos that erupts as a chance to settle an old score. Drama based on books by Jacqueline Wilson, starring Miles Butler-Hughton and Sarah Rayson.(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Everyone's missing Mike, so Kazima suggests a trip out to raise the young people's spirits. However, it is not long before they get lost in the countryside. Meanwhile, Ryan starts to wonder if he's gone too far. Drama based on books by Jacqueline Wilson, starring Akuc Bol and Lewis Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: With the clock ticking, Ryan pursues a high-risk strategy to get Mike reinstated at Ashdene Ridge. But can he pull off his master plan without anyone noticing? Drama based on books by Jacqueline Wilson, starring Connor Byrne and Lewis Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Gangsta Granny
programme.desc: Family comedy based on the children's novel by David Walliams. Schoolboy Ben is bored witless after being made to stay with his grandma. All she ever wants to do is play Scrabble and eat yucky cabbage soup. But it turns out there's a whole lot more to this OAP than cardigans and toffees when she tells him how she used to be an international jewel thief - and when she admits there was one heist she never quite managed in her heyday, the pair set out on a criminal adventure. Julie McKenzie stars as the shady senior citizen, with Walliams and Miranda Hart as the boys' ballroom-dancing parents, alongside Joanna Lumley, Rob Brydon and none other than Robbie Williams, with Reece Buttery as Ben.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter

programme.desc: The pre-school observational documentary series continues with a new family. It's washing day and the girls are trying to help Mum to fold the clothes before they find a better use for the washing basket. The family takes a trip to pick some fruit but will they find enough berries to bake a pie.

programme.desc: Rex gets a little too close for comfort when Arsenal player Rachel Yankey teaches the team all about finding space. Meanwhile it's a tight squeeze at Pupton Park when the Pups take on Spottingham Forest in a match indoors.

programme.desc: Grandma buys a housewarming present for the twins - an apple tree, which the Topsy and Tim help to plant in the garden.

programme.desc: Rowan and her mummy Erin go on a journey of discovery to find out what life was like for a child 2,500 years ago during a time called the Iron Age. Rowan and Erin dress up in clothes from that time and together they find out about a girl called Cartimandua. They visit a special house on water that Cartimandua could have lived in with her family and animals. They find out why it was called the Iron Age and that during the Iron Age if you wanted something you had to make it. They even go exploring in a dugout canoe.
